name: PreventiveCareInitialVisit12AndOlder
title: Preventive Care Initial Visit, 12 And Older
description: Value set created to identify Preventive Care Initial Visit codes for patients age 12 and older.  This value set can be grouped with either the Preventive Care Initial Visit  codes for the younger age groups or with the Preventive Care Subsequent Visit value sets.
purpose: (Clinical Focus: Identify Preventive Care Initial Visit codes for the population age 12 and older.),(Data Element Scope: Encounters and Procedures performed that are  Preventive Care Initial Visit for the population age 12 and older.),(Inclusion Criteria: Preventive Care Initial Visit for the population age 12 and older.),(Exclusion Criteria: Preventive Care Initial Visit for the population less than age 12, not a preventive care initial visit.)

concept.display: Initial comprehensive preventive medicine evaluation and management of an individual including an age and gender appropriate history, examination, counseling/anticipatory guidance/risk factor reduction interventions, and the ordering of laboratory/diagnostic procedures, new patient; adolescent (age 12 through 17 years)
